thread.title: Loyola Chicago Suffers 3-0 Loss to Wisconsin Despite Strong Play
thread.title_full: Loyola Chicago Suffers 3-0 Loss to Wisconsin Despite Strong Play

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Loyola Chicago Suffers 3-0 Loss to Wisconsin Despite Strong Play
text:
Loyola Chicago Suffers 3-0 Loss to Wisconsin Despite Strong Play
The
Loyola Chicago women's soccer team demonstrated strong play for the first 80 minutes against Wisconsin but ultimately fell 3-0 after a barrage of three goals in just five minutes during the second half. Head coach Angela Staveskie praised her team's first-half performance but noted a decline in composure as the game progressed. The loss brings Loyola's record to 2-1-1 after an impressive start to the season.
- Allison Deardorff recorded four saves, matching her season and career-high.
- This was Loyola's first shutout loss of the 2024 season.
- The Ramblers dominated the first half, creating numerous scoring opportunities.
- In the second half, despite early chances, the team allowed three goals in rapid succession.
Loyola Chicago will look to rebound as they host Bowling Green on Sunday, September 1, at 1 p.m. during their Alopecia Awareness match.Bottom Line
The Ramblers need to maintain their early-season momentum while learning from this loss to build resilience against tougher opponents.

 Loyola University Chicago Athletics
